summary.intent: Wire the wallet withdraw feature to the real repository provider and replace mock 2FA backup codes with cryptographically secure random generation.
summary.outcome: Successfully replaced Future.delayed placeholder with real walletRepositoryProvider.withdrawFunds() call with proper error handling, and replaced DateTime-based mock backup codes with Random.secure() implementation. Both tasks passed flutter analyze with no new errors.

repo: CyberVPN mobile app uses Riverpod 3.x with ConsumerStatefulWidget pattern requiring ref.read() for provider access
Wallet repository has full withdraw implementation via withdrawFunds() returning Future<Either<Failure, Unit>>
Error handling pattern uses SnackBar with failure.message for user-friendly error display

code.finding: Future.delayed placeholder removed and replaced with real repository call using Either monad pattern with fold() for success/failure handling
Mock backup codes using DateTime.now().millisecondsSinceEpoch replaced with Random.secure() for cryptographic randomness

workflow: Read repository interface and implementation files first to understand method signatures before making changes
Run flutter analyze after changes to ensure no new errors introduced
Mark tasks in_progress when starting and completed immediately upon finishing each task

friction: 1159 pre-existing lint warnings in codebase unrelated to current work
